customer_addr:
M S C 201, 700 University Blvd
KINGSVILLE, TX 78363

citations.narrative:
On 10/7/22 one adult Buck # 2 identified as “Huck “died after being handled for routine antler cutting. Huck was known to
be an animal with a high flight zone and was described as agitated prior to entering the deer chute. Once in the chute, he
immediately struggled and was found to be turned around facing the opposite direction. It was noted his head was up and
he was panting. Instead of releasing the deer immediately, the decision was made to complete the procedure prior to
releasing the animal from the chute. Upon release, his gait was noted to be wobbly, but he walked on his own to his
holding enclosure. Approximately, thirty minutes later, he was found down with signs of a possible neurological injury and
was euthanized. Handling of all animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does
not cause trauma, physical harm or unnecessary harm. Correct By : From this day forward

The wood lining the inside of the deer chute has several areas that are rough and splintered. The splintered wood is an
area that may cause injury to the animals when they are in the chute. Facilities shall be maintained in good repair to
prevent injury. Correct By: 3/28/23
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility employees.
End Section

narrative:
2.38(f)(1)  Critical
   
Miscellaneous. 
On 10/7/22 one adult Buck # 2 identified as “Huck “died after being handled for routine antler cutting. Huck was known to 
be an animal with a high flight zone and was described as agitated prior to entering the deer chute. Once in the chute, he 
immediately struggled and was found to be turned around facing the opposite direction. It was noted his head was up and 
he was panting. Instead of releasing the deer immediately, the decision was made to complete the procedure prior to 
releasing the animal from the chute. Upon release, his gait was noted to be wobbly, but he walked on his own to his 
holding enclosure. Approximately, thirty minutes later, he was found down with signs of a possible neurological injury and 
was euthanized. Handling of all animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does 
not cause trauma, physical harm or unnecessary harm.  Correct By : From this day forward 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The wood lining the inside of the deer chute has several areas that are rough and splintered. The splintered wood is an 
area that may cause  injury to the animals when they are in the chute. Facilities shall be maintained in good repair to 
prevent injury. Correct By:  3/28/23 
 
This inspection and exit briefing  were conducted with facility employees.

End Section
